data.scheme_name: Integrated and Sustainable Textile Policy 2023-28 - Non-Conventional Yarn/Fiber and Synthetic Yarn / Fiber - Capital Subsidy - Female - All Categories - Existing
data.benefits: Scheme provides financial assistance in the form of capital subsidy 50% on fixed capital investment  to the Non-Conventional Yarn/Fiber and Synthetic Yarn / Fiber units.
data.eligibility: All existing units engaged in Non-Conventional Yarn/Fiber and Synthetic Yarn / Fiber sector are eligible under the scheme.
data.conditions:
1. Any existing project increasing its fixed capital investment by 25% and increasing its total production capacity by 25% as compared to the previous year. 
  2. The Project must generate 10% more employment than the existing project. 
  3. The detailed project report (DPR) of the new textile unit will include the cost of setting up the solar power plant up to a maximum limit of 4 MW. 
  4. If a unit has more than 50 women employees, it must provide a childcare facility to more than 50% of the employees. 
  5. More than 50% of the employees working must be women in the units being run by women. 
  6. In the case of electricity subsidy for existing units, subsidy will be provided or a period of 2 years only. 
  7. Post the set period of 2 years, no electricity subsidy will be provided. 
  8. However, the subsidy amount of 12 months will be calculated and provided as capital subsidy for establishment of solar power plant.
data.beneficiaries: All existing units engaged in Non-Conventional Yarn/Fiber and Synthetic Yarn / Fiber sector are eligible under the scheme.
data.prerequisites:
1. Any existing project increasing its fixed capital investment by 25% and increasing its total production capacity by 25% as compared to the previous year. 
  2. The Project must generate 10% more employment than the existing project. 
  3. The detailed project report (DPR) of the new textile unit will include the cost of setting up the solar power plant up to a maximum limit of 4 MW. 
  4. If a unit has more than 50 women employees, it must provide a childcare facility to more than 50% of the employees. 
  5. More than 50% of the employees working must be women in the units being run by women. 
  6. In the case of electricity subsidy for existing units, subsidy will be provided or a period of 2 years only. 
  7. Post the set period of 2 years, no electricity subsidy will be provided. 
  8. However, the subsidy amount of 12 months will be calculated and provided as capital subsidy for establishment of solar power plant.
data.context:
• Integrated and Sustainable Textile Policy of the State is in line with the 5F vision of the Government of India- Farm to Fiber to Factory to Fashion to Foreign. 
  • The policy envisions integrating the whole textile value chain and create an enabling environment for sustained growth of all sub-sectors in the industry.
data.objective: The objective of this scheme is to strengthen the sector and encourage units in various parts of the State.
data.description:
Scheme provides financial assistance in the form of capital subsidy to the Non-Conventional Yarn/Fiber and Synthetic Yarn / Fiber based on the following Zones : For MSMEs 

  1. Zone 1 : 50% on fixed capital investment 
  2. Zone 2 : 45% on fixed capital investment 
  3. Zone 3 : 40% on fixed capital investment 
  4. Zone 4 : 35% on fixed capital investment Electricity subsidy for 12 months (i.e. there will be a cap of Rs. 40 lakh per unit per month on the disbursement of monthly electricity subsidy/ cost of the power plant up to maximum of 4MW/ capping of INR 4.8 crore, whichever is less)
data.how_to_apply: The applicant can apply through the Maharashtra Textile Department : https://etextile.maharashtra.gov.in/registration
data.funding_mechanism:
1. The capital subsidy will be provided in 2 equal instalments (with a gap of six months between the instalments) post the operationalization of solar power plant. 
  2. This will be paid in two installments: 
    • 1st instalment: 60% of eligible amount after 12 months. 
    • 2nd instalment: 40% of eligible amount after 24 months.
data.additional_info:
• Zone 1: - Amravati, Akola, Amravati, Buldhana, Bhandara, Chandrapur, Gadchiroli, Gondia, Nagpur, Washim, Wardha, Yavatmal. 
  • Zone 2: - Aurangabad, Beed, Dhule, Hingoli, Jalgaon, Jalna, Latur, Nanded, Osmanabad, Parbhani. 
  • Zone 3: - Ahmednagar, Nashik, Nandurbar. 
  • Zone 4: - Kolhapur, Mumbai City, Mumbai Suburban, Palaghar, Pune, Ratnagiri, Raigad, Sindhudurg, Sangli, Satara, Solapur, Thane. Any existing project increasing its fixed capital investment by 25% and increasing its total production capacity by 25% as compared to the previous year. The Project must generate 10% more employment than the existing project. Such expansion will include forward and backward integration.
data.checklist_info_a:
Udyam Registration Certificate 
GST Certificate 
Financials for Last 2 years 
Projected financial data 
Lending Bank Details 
Basic KYC Documents
Detailed Project Report (DPR)
data.checklist_info_d:
Address : Government of Maharashtra, Co-operation, Marketing and Textile Department, Mantralaya, Mumbai 400032
Email : textilepolicy-mah[At]gov[Dot]in
Phone No..: 022-22026805
data.beneficiary: Manufacturing Textile Industry - All Entities - Maharashtra - All MSMEs
data.lifecycle: Required Credit Support for Scale - Up
